definition: official communication (between gov. offices of equal rank)/report delivered by the head of gov. on affairs of state

sentences.english: President George Bush delivers his last state-of-the-union address.
sentences.chinese: 布希总统发表最后一次国情咨文。

sentences.english: My last State of the Union address was a joy to deliver.
sentences.chinese: 发表最后一个国情咨文演讲时，我的心情很好。

sentences.english: President Obama’s State of the Union address was a ho-hum affair.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统的国情咨文讲话是一件乏味无聊的事件。

sentences.english: " Durbin was on CNN's "State of the Union.
sentences.chinese: 杜宾在美国有线电视新闻网的“国情咨文”中出现。

sentences.english: Reaction to the president's address has been mixed.
sentences.chinese: 公众对奥巴马国情咨文讲话的反应不一。

sentences.english: The president broadcast his message on all stations yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 总统于昨天通过所有电台发表了咨文。

sentences.english: Firm talk about the budget in his state-of-the-union message would help.
sentences.chinese: 在国情咨文里坚定的谈论预算会有帮助。

definition: to lay out (an argument) item by item/memorandum to a superior
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
credentials (of a diplomat)/documents exchanged between nations/national or dynastic history book
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
